{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3552653,"name":"Ana Luiza Almeida","username":"naluiza","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/ba9def/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-10T13:28:05.584Z","cooked":"

Hello everyone, I’d like to know if there’s a standard font for bumpers. If there isn’t one, I’d like to know which one is most commonly used

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-03-10T13:28:05.584Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":46,"reads":273,"readers_count":272,"score":284.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":494961,"topic_slug":"what-font-did-you-use-for-the-number-of-your-bumpers","display_username":"Ana Luiza Almeida","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":73428,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/what-font-did-you-use-for-the-number-of-your-bumpers/494961/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3552659,"name":"Sean McMahon (he/him)","username":"smcmahon","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/smcmahon/{size}/253640_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-10T13:30:54.112Z","cooked":"

There’s no standard font that I know of, though there are rules for the bumper numbers. 2656 uses Hemi Head

I found a Easter egg in Google searching for a commonly used bumper number font

image901×1120 123 KB

I would recommend a bold/black/heavy grotesque font that will be easy to read from a distance. Some of these are good candidates:

Google Fonts

Browse Fonts - Google Fonts

Making the web more beautiful, fast, and open through great typography

We use Space Age because its the team font, but I don’t recommend it. We have to shrink it by about 10% in width to get it to fit on the bumpers even using the allowed tolerance to get .15" below the “minimum” number height.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-03-10T13:45:47.749Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":209,"readers_count":208,"score":41.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":494961,"topic_slug":"what-font-did-you-use-for-the-number-of-your-bumpers","display_username":"Patrick","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52597,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Build mentor"},"post_url":"/t/what-font-did-you-use-for-the-number-of-your-bumpers/494961/5","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3552698,"name":"Dominick Ferone","username":"Dominick_Ferone","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dominick_ferone/{size}/236622_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-10T14:11:52.558Z","cooked":"

We have been using the Batman Forever Font.

Our students chose this font a few years ago because they liked the look.
In a funny coincidence, I chose this font back in the day for 5030, because I liked the look.

We’ve used Boink LET for as long as bumpers have been required. It’s a love it or hate it sort of font.

IMG_20250228_202255740845×1623 200 KB

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-03-10T14:17:21.507Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":185,"readers_count":184,"score":37.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":494961,"topic_slug":"what-font-did-you-use-for-the-number-of-your-bumpers","display_username":"Ken Pontbriant","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":17612,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 230 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/what-font-did-you-use-for-the-number-of-your-bumpers/494961/7","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3552726,"name":"Christine Low","username":"SurfGear","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/surfgear/{size}/120560_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-10T14:33:16.875Z","cooked":"

No standard font. We use Daggersquare, but whatever you do- make your numbers slightly taller than the minimum required.

(Why? Iron-on vinyl can shrink slightly. Tape measures can vary. People can be difficult. Save yourself - add a little extra to your number height).

image871×431 49.3 KB

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-03-10T19:47:49.720Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":157,"readers_count":156,"score":76.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":494961,"topic_slug":"what-font-did-you-use-for-the-number-of-your-bumpers","display_username":"Christine Low","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32239,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Coach 3128 - Mech, Laser, Bumpers, Fix all the Things, Travel"},"post_url":"/t/what-font-did-you-use-for-the-number-of-your-bumpers/494961/8","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3552748,"name":"","username":"pigrammer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pigrammer/{size}/234083_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-10T14:52:37.231Z","cooked":"

While others have mentioned it, the explicit rule is, in R412A:

consist of only white Arabic numerals at least 3 ¾ in. (~96 mm) high, at least ½ in. (~13 mm) in stroke width,

The blue box clarifies that

The ½ in. (~13 mm) stroke width requirement applies to the majority of the stroke. Font elements less than ½ in. (~13 mm) such as serifs, rounded edges, small hairlines or gaps, etc. are permitted as long as the majority of the stroke meets the sizing requirement and the numbers are unambiguous.

These are the requirements you must meet with your font, along with the number being clearly read by an oberster on any side of the robot from up to 60 feet away

We’ve used Airstrike since 2017.
